page.title: 14Mr.P.Marsh-morning Lydden
page.content: A day in the life of Peter Dudley Marsh Architect,Diploma in Building Conservation,Associate of the Royal Institute of British Architects,Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London.Rose at 0710,to be confronted with the muddle of clothes and equipment which emanated from three days sailing in a small yacht,which ended last evening.Got dressed,washed and shaved.Valerie,my wife,brought me a cup of tea whilst I said goodbye to my youngest son,Henry,who was just getting up.Left house at 0805 by car to catch 0825 train from Dover Priory Station to London Charing Cross.I had a meeting of the Craft Committee of the Worshipful Company of Masons,of which I am a Liveryman, in Chelsea.I arrived there after taking the tube from Charing Cross to South Kensington, changing at the Embankment-cost 40p.
